clinical_study.brief_title: Treadmill Stress Test With and Without Mask
clinical_study.official_title: Treadmill Stress Test With and Without Mask: Comparison of Exercise Capacity and Perception

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess if wearing a surgical mask affects the results of a standard treadmill test.

detailed_description.textblock: The persons interested to participate will be informed of the implication and potential risks associated with the study. The participants that accept and meet the eligibility criteria will give written consent and be randomized into two groups. One group will first perform a treadmill test with a surgical mask and then repeat the test without a mask. The second group will do the first treadmill test without a mask and the second one with a surgical mask.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Equivalents With vs Without a Mask
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The maximal metabolic equivalents achieved will be calculated for each treadmill test performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Borg's Category-Ratio Scale for Rating of Perceived Exertion With vs Without a Mask
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: The Borg Scale is a self-reporting instrument assessing intensity of perceived exertion on a 0 to 10 scale, 0 being rest and 10 maximal effort.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Exercise Duration With vs Without a Mask
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 week

arm_group.description: Participants will first perform a treadmill test with a mask and 48 hours or more later will perform another similar treadmill test without a mask.
Participants will first perform a treadmill test without a mask and 48 hours or more later will perform another similar treadmill test with a mask.

intervention.description: Treadmill test performed with and without a mask.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (18-65 years old)
- Healthy
- Vaccinated against COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any cardiac or respiratory condition
- Walking difficulty
- Waiting for a stress test for a medical reason
- Abnormal resting ECG
- Inability to wear a mask
- Inability to understand or follow the instructions
- Medical contraindication to performing a treadmill stress test
